items.follow_up_question: What are the names, scales, and allowable values of the "24 most vocationally significant McDOT variables" used for worker-job matching?
items.filled_answer: R M L S P Q K F M E C + PD1..PD6 + EC1..EC7 with scales defined in MVQS codes/manual content and mirrored in src/traits.js.
items.implementation_handling: Lock this as the canonical trait dictionary for matching/reporting.

evidence.note: Defines trait codes and min/max bounds.
Lists codes, labels, and scales.

items.follow_up_question: What are the explicit rules for converting each assessment source (paper-pencil, work samples, functional capacity, structured interviews) into each of the 24 variable scores?
items.filled_answer: Manuals provide worksheet/percentile approximation guidance, but no single explicit end-to-end algorithm maps every instrument to every trait.
items.implementation_handling: Document partial guidance and treat full mapping as a blocker for exact legacy parity.

evidence.note: Contains worksheet and approximation tables, not full instrument-to-trait equations.

items.follow_up_question: What does each field represent, what is its scaling, and how do these fields correspond to the claimed "4 Factor, 24 Worker Trait-Level" structure?
items.filled_answer: Legacy report headers show RMLSPQKFMEC1234561234567 and map to GED + aptitudes + PD1-6 + EC1-7. GVN variant wording is not fully documented.
items.implementation_handling: Standardize modern display using RML/SPQKFMEC/PD1-6/EC1-7 mapping and note unresolved header variant semantics.

evidence.note: Shows report headers with RMLSPQKFMEC1234561234567.
Uses trait order R M L S P Q K F M E C | PD1..PD6 | EC1..EC7.

items.follow_up_question: For each matching pattern (McDOT digit matches and O*NET digit matches), what tens-digit value is assigned and why?
items.filled_answer: Current deriveMtspTier implementation maps documented pattern classes into five MTSP tiers, but no legacy-published exact tens-digit table is available.
items.implementation_handling: Retain current tier map and publish as an explicit assumption.

evidence.note: deriveMtspTier contains rule mapping.
Defines pattern classes and level ranges.

items.follow_up_question: Is the ones digit incremented by exactly 1 per match across SIC, SOC, CEN, MPSMS, WF1, IND? Are any crosswalks weighted differently?
items.filled_answer: Legacy text says ones digit accumulates per crosswalk match, but exact per-code weighting is not published.
items.implementation_handling: Keep modern crosswalk composite behavior and annotate that exact legacy per-crosswalk weighting remains unresolved.

evidence.note: Mentions accumulation across crosswalk codes.
v3 overlay applies composite crosswalk contribution.

items.follow_up_question: What is the exact transformation function, including any normalization or scaling constants, that converts the raw score to the percent scale?
items.filled_answer: Modern TSA exposes raw 0-46 and applies round((raw/46)*97,1). Legacy SSTS documents also show a separate raw/6*100 matrix in a different context.
items.implementation_handling: Publish 0-46 to 0-97 transform as current model assumption and preserve audit trace fields.

evidence.note: legacy_trace and raw transform fields.
Shows raw/6*100 matrix in SSTS material.

items.follow_up_question: What O*NET elements are used for VQ1, what weighting is applied, and what formula produces VQ1?
items.filled_answer: Exact VQ1 derivation formula is not recoverable from currently available local source material.
items.implementation_handling: Treat as blocker requiring primary source extraction/tables.

evidence.note: Documents the gap and asks for exact VQ1 derivation.

items.follow_up_question: What is the exact transformation equation used to convert the raw sum (0 to 204) to the VQ metric, including rounding rules?
items.filled_answer: Recovered direct basCalculate_VQ intercept and trait coefficients from Option Compare Database module export; modern app now computes deterministic profile VQ values using those constants.
items.implementation_handling: Use recovered coefficients for profile VQ computation and expose methodology metadata in payloads/reports.

evidence.note: Contains basCalculate_VQ function with intercept and per-trait coefficients.
computeLegacyProfileVq implements recovered basCalculate_VQ coefficients.

items.follow_up_question: When the source states "only those target jobs matching the worker’s evaluative data profile," is match defined as equality, range overlap, threshold proximity, or weighted similarity?
items.filled_answer: Current implementation uses strict all-trait non-deficit profile gating (target <= profile across all 24 traits), then weighted ranking/scoring.
items.implementation_handling: Document this as the operational match rule for current model behavior.

evidence.note: profile_gate_failed logic and strict gating in TSA computation.

items.follow_up_question: When "Average Hourly Wage" is calculated for job types and then paired to integer VQ points, are averages weighted by openings, unweighted, or computed by another rule?
items.filled_answer: No explicit weighting rule is recoverable from currently available local source material.
items.implementation_handling: Leave unresolved and require pipeline/table-level extraction evidence.

evidence.note: Captures the unresolved weighting question.

items.follow_up_question: Which Statistica outlier diagnostic(s) were used (residual threshold, leverage, Cook’s D, etc.) and what threshold values triggered removal?
items.filled_answer: OES/Indiana materials cite 2-SD style outlier definitions; state work-order Statistica diagnostics/thresholds are not explicitly identified.
items.implementation_handling: Mark unresolved for state pipeline parity and require explicit diagnostic references.

evidence.note: Documents the discrepancy between cited tools and missing explicit diagnostics.

items.follow_up_question: For Louisiana pipelines, which work-order totals are correct (for example, 24,657 vs 26,641), and what caused the discrepancy between narrative counts and Table 1 counts?
items.filled_answer: Count discrepancy is identified but not resolved by currently available local source material.
items.implementation_handling: Track as blocker needing primary source reconciliation.

evidence.note: Explicitly records unresolved Louisiana sample-size conflict.

items.follow_up_question: What is the exact procedure, data source, and formula used to apply link relatives for geographic wage differences and inflation adjustments to the OES-based wage estimates?
items.filled_answer: Intent and supporting concepts (ECLR, wage growth, link-relative rationale) are documented, but exact computational sequence is not fully specified.
items.implementation_handling: Preserve current behavior and flag exact formula as unresolved.

evidence.note: Discusses link relatives and adjustment intent without complete implementation sequence.

items.follow_up_question: For each of the "5 report output formats" in McDOT and the MTSP report styles, what sections, variables, and calculations appear, and what are the formatting rules?
items.filled_answer: Legacy runbook enumerates report titles/menus (McDOT 1-5, McPLOT 1-5, MTSP 1-22), but complete field-level rendering rules for all formats remain partial.
items.implementation_handling: Implement core MTSP report expansion and defer full 1-22 parity.

evidence.note: Enumerates report menus and report titles.
Current transferable report implementation baseline.
